column1: The '''Desolation of the Morannon''' was the dead land that lay just before walls of [[Mordor]] south of the [[Dagorlad]]. The terrible barrenness of the landscape was due to the labours of [[Sauron]]'s slaves
column2: who had so defiled the land that it was diseased beyond repair. It was a foul place of horror for absolutely nothing grew in the polluted soil.  Pools of water were choked with ash and muds
column3: slag-mounds of crushed and powered rock abounded
column4: and cones of earth fire-blasted and stained with poison rose as if they were part of a graveyard.  <ref>{{TT|IV2}}</ref>

column3: reached the Desolation of the Morannon on [[4 March]]
